column5: Wanted to fish the niagara but it looked like chocolate milk. Checked Port D. and the water was green with about 3-4 foot vis. Water temp. was 39-40 F. and the air temp stayed well below freezing all day, had to lather the electric motor up with fish scent to keep it from freezing. Cought a couple nice steelhead and my brother cought a small (12-13") coho up near the rapids. Got sick of the crowds up there so we tried pulling kwickfish and spinner rigs down closer to the lake. cought 1 more nice steelhead and missed another, both on the spinner rig.  Heres a couple of pics.
Great stuff animal ! Die hard for sure !
Very nice colours on those fish!!!  Congrats on a successful day out there.
That's strange...bly says the same thing.  I can see them at work, but she cant at home....hmmmmmmmm.
Hit refresh Cliff... they'll be gone for you as well !
Wow...it's magic.  Thanks Wanye...now I cant see the pretty fish...  Why did I do that...why did I do that???   Oh yeah...cause I'm a guy...LOL  Oh Rick!!!! You have some 'splainin to do!!!
Danimal,  Niiiice!!   Oh I wish the tribs in the area weren't already frozen....
NICE FALL/WINTER STEELHEAD !!!!!! great pics too.  way to go for battling that nasty weather out there on lake ontario !!!! cheers
Really nice to see a local fishin report .Nice pics and you are a die hard for sure.Can't wait for the ice
